1824–1936 A small collection of deeds, address books, and financial items stemming from the Bronx-based Bush family, descendants of Scottish immigrant John S. Bush (1844–1913). Includes minutes of the John S. Bush Manufacturing Co., purveyors of ice, wood, and coal (1909–1919), and European travel diaries kept by Frances Maude (Morris) Bush (1928–1936).
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Carol Bush Richter (accession no. MS-2019-045), September 13, 2019.
Arrangement
The collection is organized in five chronological series:
Series I.
Real estate, 1824–1893
Series II.
Financial, 1874–1899, undated
Series III.
Address books, circa 1887–1891, undated
Series IV.
John S. Bush Manufacturing Co., 1909–1919
Series V.
Frances Maude (Morris) Bush travel diaries, 1928–1936
Biographical / Historical
Scottish immigrant John Stearns Bush (1844–1913) married Mary Jane Berrian (circa 1846–1920), a daughter of William Davis Berrian (1817–1903), in 1868. The couple had three known children—Marie Natalie (Bush) Balcom, John H. Bush, and William Berrian Bush—all of whom were officers or shareholders in the John S. Bush Manufacturing Co., the Bronx-based ice, coal, and wood business incorporated by the elder Bush in 1909. William Berrian Bush married in New York, in 1904, Frances Maude Morris (1871–1959).
[All names underlined are represented by documents in the present collection.]
Preferred Citation
The collection should be cited as: "Bush Family Papers, MS 3197, New-York Historical Society."
Processing Information
Archivist Joseph Ditta arranged and described this collection in November 2020.
Scope and Contents
The collection includes deeds, mortgages, and title abstracts for properties in The Bronx and in New Rochelle, Westchester County, New York, from the period 1824–1893; some financial fragments—a blank checkbook, some blank deposit slips, and a bankbook in the name of William D. Berrian in trust for the children of his daughter, Mary J. (Berrian) Bush—dating from 1874–1899; four address books, circa 1887–1891; minutes of the John S. Bush Manufacturing Co., purveyors of ice, wood, and coal, 1909–1919; and five travel diaries kept in 1928–1936 by Frances Maude (Morris) Bush of her ocean voyages to England, France, Italy, and other European countries.
